title: Processes - Second Derivative of Parametric Eqs

content.question: If <math alttext="x equals, t to the fourth power, minus 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></math> and <math alttext="y equals, 4 t plus 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></math>, what is <math alttext="the second derivative of y, with respect to x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><msup><mo>ⅆ</mo><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math> in terms of <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the negative of the fraction 3 over t to the fourth power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>−</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the negative of the fraction 3 over 4 times t to the fifth power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>−</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the negative of the fraction 3 over 4 times t to the seventh power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>−</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the negative of the fraction 3 over 4 times t to the seventh power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>−</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.2: (BC ONLY) Second Derivatives of Parametric Equations

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
